column4: does anyone know how to do transparent (non-clickable) output of text (logs and stuff) on the desktop ?
tricky in gnome because nautilus draws the desktop
depends - quick and dirty way is with checkinstall
warning - roottail won't show on a standard gnome desktop
it draws on the root window, which gnome hides - it works in window managers like fluxbox
so i can't just change some gnome setting ?
there's probably a way to do it in gnome, but how I don't personally know
I would read "man root-tail " first - there are a lot of options. I don't use it any more because I cn get the same effect in fluxbox by toggling window borders off
graveman
yes, known bug
try setting synaptic to not do daily updates automatically
no, you misundestood me - I mean if you diable automatic updates in synaptic it cures the problem with apt-cache
I also use apt-get  /apt-cache - but it appears synaptic runs a daily cron and if you aren't connected it failsd
from memory you go into the repository settings and find the options
yup
I just unchecked it
no guarantees - but seemed to fix it here
*cough8
we don't encourage running as root here ;)
sure - install streamtuner and you'll have access to shoutcast
only its audio streams, not the video ones...
ah, video I don't know...
ubuntu-desktop is just a metapackage
